main event: A radar target was acquired, identified as a UFO near Westboro, Mass., on June 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object was tracked at about 30,000 ft but visually appeared at 12,000-15,000 ft., The object made a 180-degree turn and traveled back east at a high rate of speed., It was described as very bright, brighter than the stars., The investigation concluded there might be misinterpretation but could not definitively classify the object., A visual observer noted the object was not an aircraft at any time.
sighted object: UFO tracked by radar, visually observed
witness description: The visual observer provided details about the object's appearance and movement.
